While the case itself was kinda obvious, the episode was still really entertaining. The sets eg. [The drug den inside the mountain, the mountain itself, Sehyung's secret hacking station](/spoiler) were all really cool, and there were lots of good jokes in there as well like [Sehyung as the nature guy and Kim Jihoon making fun of Park Jiyoon for having the same name as the victim](/spoiler) PJY and Jang Jin both did well investigating, and YSH was hilarious as always. KJH continues to do well in finding clues and is starting to become more light-hearted and have fun like he did in S2 I think Eunji's "problem" is that she's too focused on the case and finding evidence, instead of making jokes and being over the top with characters like the others, but I think she did pretty well this episode [I was happy for them at the end when all the main cast voted for the right person and they were all cheering, as well as when they revealed that Jihoon was the real father lmao. And I got goosebumps when they revealed that they were gonna go back to solve the serial killer school case](/spoiler) Overall, great episode with the cast improving and getting to know each other better. Hyped for next week and Kong!

S1: Jinho, Kyungran, Sunggyu S2: Sangmin, Yohwan, Junghyun, Hongchul, Yooyoung S3: Dongmin, Hyunmin, Youhyun, Ahyoung (not really a genius, but she's entertaining) Last spot could go to Yoonsun (strong female), Doohee (because he got screwed the first time) or Yeonseung (to complete the top 3 of all seasons) Of course, S4 and the cast are still amazing and the people who make you go "wtf" about the casting definitely earn their spot, imo

Pretty good episode overall [Jang Jin finally becomes criminal breaking his streak: Check](/spoiler) [Criminal gets away with it: Check](/spoiler) [Master detective Pyo Changwon redeems himself: Check](/spoiler) [Makjang with many (maybe too many) twists and turns: Check](/spoiler) [Hilarious Kim Jihoon character: Check](/spoiler) [Bringing Jang Sungkyu as the victim was cool as well and he added a lot to the victim's story, especially since he was essentially a bad guy. Only bad thing was that since Eunji and Jinho were pretty much ruled out from being the killer early, they didn't really have many memorable moments other than their cute relationship and "jojang!"](/spoiler) Hyped for Sojin and I'm hoping the finale will have 6 suspects (5 regular + Jinho) with another guest detective, or a 2-parter where the detective becomes a suspect in the second half

New Dalcom coin currency which you can spend on: **A/S/R Card Selector** (basically just pick whatever card you want and you can get it but it's expensive of course), **Theme Exchange** (change a card to another random theme) and **10%/30%/50%/70%/100% Power Up Cards** (you can use these to upgrade cards instead of using other normal cards) Buy inventory slots for 50 diamonds, instead of 50 - gt; 100 - gt; 200 - gt; 400 like it used to be You can get R cards in PCP + higher chance of getting better cards overall It costs less to upgrade apparently, and higher success rates? Also costs 20,000 to upgrade S to R Takes longer for headphones to regenerate https://www.reddit.com/r/superstarsmtown/comments/6snubq/supplement_for_ssm_220_update/

WRITING.TITLE: What is the best way to organise your inventory?
WRITING.TEXT: Basically I have a ton of C and B cards in my inventory that I probably don't need, however I obviously need to double-check most of them in case I can power them up because that artist only has a few low cards. Recently I've just been buying more inventory space because it only costs 50 diamonds but that just delays the problem ahah So what is the easiest and most efficient way to get rid all of the low cards I don't need while making sure not to use cards that I actually do need? Thanks!
I was thinking of making my own one, but this is very useful. Thanks!

I agree that the Cinema Theory videos shouldn't be allowed on the sub. BBC and the girls have explicitly stated that so I think we should respect it Obviously we know they're gonna be leaked and all over Twitter/Discord/Streamable etc, but that can't really be stopped easily and if BBC wants it to be removed, they'll contact that person eg. loonacunt directly. However, since this is a public subreddit and it's the "official" one, I don't think we should condone it since it's technically illegal Yes, this doesn't really make sense but I hope you understand what I'm trying to say. Yes, we're all gonna watch it anyway but I think since this is the "official" subreddit and we're "representing international fans" in a way, I think we should just play it safe and not participate in spreading the exclusive vids

WRITING.TITLE: Upgraded Secret Base Trade Master
WRITING.TEXT: If he offers you a trade and the Pokemon he wants is not currently in your party, you have to reject the offer. But because you rejected the offer, he will offer you a different trade when you go to talk to him again. So how are you supposed to know what Pokemon he wants in return, go catch that Pokemon or get it from your PC, and then go back to him and accept the offer?
Ah nice thanks!

WRITING.TITLE: Support Gift Project for Haseul!

WRITING.TEXT: Some fellow kind Orbits have started a Gift Project to raise money for a custom in-ear monitor for our leader Haseul! Feel free to donate as much or as little as you want, all info is in the Twitter thread linked or you can check out their [gofundme page](https://www.gofundme.com/haseul) Thanks, hope you can support and share this around!
